sources.title: Say It with Songs (1929) AL JOLSONüçï UNMASKEDüçï MUSICAL MELODRAMA
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Stars: Al Jolson, Davey Lee, Marian Nixon
Director: Lloyd Bacon
üçïAl Jolson UNMASKEDüçï
Step back into Hollywood history with the legendary Al Jolson in his first ALL-TALKING picture ‚Äî and the FIRST-TIME on screen his musical numbers are performed without the theatrical makeup that had been a hallmark of Jolson‚Äôs earlier cinema and vaudeville career.

Al Jolson shot to international fame in The Jazz Singer, delivering the iconic phrase, "You ain't heard nothin' yet," that rang the death knell for the silent film era. However, his third feature film fully embraced the potential of the talking picture revolution, offering heartfelt performances and emotionally charged musical numbers that captivated audiences.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

metadata.Plot: Joe Lane kills another man in a fistfight after learning that the man has made improper advances towards his wife. Joe goes to prison for the murder. When Joe gets out of prison, he visits his son "Little Pal" at school. Little Pal tries to follow Joe downtown, but is hit by a truck.
metadata.Writer: Darryl F. Zanuck, Harvey Gates, Joseph Jackson
metadata.Actors: Al Jolson, Davey Lee, Marian Nixon
